oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Col. William Campbell certificate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Certificate regarding the conduct of Col. William Campbell at the Battle of King's Mountain.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Battlefields
United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783; King's Mountain, Battle of, S.C., 1780; Campbell, William, -- 1745-1781.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Campbell was one of the thirteen colonial signers of the earliest statement of armed resistance to the British Crown. He defeated the Tories and Loyalists at the Battle of King's Mountain in the Carolinas. He married Patrick Henry's sister, Elizabeth Henry. Campbell County, Virginia is named for him.
